description: two shirtless men climbing a tall pole, with another shirtless man bending to put his hands in a pot at LLC and a fourth shirtless man at bottom center watching climbers; woman with a dark blouse, seen from back, LRC; people looking out windows of four-story building in background; crowd on street in middle ground
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription and Stamp

LRC, in pencil: [Tir. (?) 25 E (?)]; URC, in black ink: [L.B.22]; on back, in pencil: [661], [01.1.25], [002235] and [Un 14 Juillet, Rue Galande, Le Mât de Cocagne]; see Signed
markings: LRC of image, stamped in red: [AL]; LRC of sheet, stamped in black: [RMx]
provenance: Roger Marx, Lugt 2229 (1859-1913), Paris. [Eric G. Carlson Fine Prints and Drawings, New York, until 2008; sold in August for PLTO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (2008-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Bastille Day on Rue Galande
